sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
In the below figure, it is given that \(\angle PQS = \angle RSQ = \angle TUQ = 90 \degree\). If \(PQ = x\) units, and \(RS = y\) units and \(TU = z \) units then prove that 
\[
	\frac{1}{x} + \frac{1}{y} = \frac{1}{z}
\]
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": " 
Suppose QU = a units and US = b units. Then we have 
\[
	QS = \input[s1v1]{}+b
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": " 
Now, in triangle TSP and triangle QST we have
\[
	\angle U\input[s2v1]{}S = \angle PQS 
\]
\[
	\angle TSU = \angle P\input[s2v2]{}Q 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that 
\[
	\Delta T\input[s3v1]{}S \sim \Delta R\input[s3v2]{}Q 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{TU }{PQ } = \frac{US }{QS }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{z}{x} = \frac{\input[s4v1]{}}{a+b}
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "Now, similarly, we can write \Delta TUQ \sim \Delta RSQ .
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{TU }{RS } = \frac{QU }{QS }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{z}{y} = \frac{\input[s6v1]{}}{a+b}
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
On adding the above two results, we get
\[
	\frac{z}{x} + \frac{z}{y} = \frac{\input[s7v1]{}+\input[s7v2]{}}{a+b} = 1
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{1}{x} + \frac{1}{y} = \frac{1}{\input[s8v1]{}}
\]"}, {"id": "s9", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["a"], "text": " "}, {"data": ["U", "S"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle TUS = \angle PQS$, since, both are $90\degree$, and $\angle TSU = \angle PSQ $, as both are the same angle.}$$"}, {"data": ["U", "S"], "text": " "}, {"data": ["b"], "text": "$$\text{Therefore, we can also write $\frac{TU }{PQ } = \frac{US }{QS }$, as ratios of corresponding sides of similar triangles is proportional, in which after putting values we get $\frac{z}{x} = \frac{b}{a+b}$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Similarly, following the above given procedure, $\Delta TUQ \sim \Delta RSQ $, thus, we can write \frac{TU }{RS } = \frac{QU }{QS }, as ratios of corresponding sides of similar triangles is proportional.}$$"}, {"data": ["a"], "text": "$$\text{Putting values in the equation we get $\frac{z}{y} = \frac{a}{a+b}$}$$"}, {"data": ["a", "b"], "text": "$$\text{Simply adding we get $\frac{z}{x} + \frac{z}{y} = \frac{a+b}{a+b} = 1$.}$$"}, {"data": ["z"], "text": "$$\text{Upon cross-multiplication we get $\frac{1}{x} + \frac{1}{y} = \frac{1}{z}$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
